info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 27 at 2:32PM EDT until July 27 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Litchfield County in northern Connecticut... Southern Berkshire County in western Massachusetts... East central Ulster County in east central New York... Northern Dutchess County in east central New York... Southern Columbia County in east central New York... Southeastern Greene County in east central New York... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 232 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Livingston, or 9 miles southeast of Catskill, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, Hudson, Catskill, Saugerties, Claverack, Livingston, Copake, Sheffield, Pine Plains, Clermont, Red Hook, Norfolk, Athens, Otis, Ancram, Philmont, Canaan, Sandisfield, Saugerties South and Ashley Falls. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
